documents.document: Good to see the driver of @metlinkwgtn bus 763 being so helpful to the woman with the baby this morning.
@_writehanded_ Thanks for letting me know about this.
Dear @WgtnCC the ballet in the Dell today was fantastic and made my kid incredibly happy, but please kill the onehunga weed. Ouch.
Really liking this artist's titles https://t.co/961scX9gfa
@Jess_McAllen no worries. It was advertised by techcommnz today as part time
@Jess_McAllen Stratigence is looking for a technical writer at the moment
@ms_pym I had a fragile one. It sucked. My current one seems to be non-fragile though, so I'm hoping it's safe to own them again.
Yes! All Things Linguistic â€” How to pluralize loanwords https://t.co/34zcNtdHkL
@thomasbeagle tweeting that my kid died rather than had a minor accident two days ago when her dad was overseas and mainly in touch here.
@AndreAlessi @mr_orgue I'm dubious that it's uniquely American. Too similar to stuff I see here.
@ceridwyn_writes I miss RWP. How are my kids meant to find eclectic mixes of interesting new music when they're 15?
@ceridwyn_writes I'd never seen that before.
@hroethgar Stung by bee. Sorry. Autocorrect.
Stung. Not dying. Stupid autocorrect.
@hroethgar again? I'm so sorry to hear that. Glad you're OK.
Well. That was an unpleasant hour. Lost cat (cleverly concealed in living room). 10-year-old dying by bee looking for cat. Dinner with kids.
@redlightvoices @DubiousStephen The Battle of Maldon comes to mind.
@shoelessgirl The Springbok riots.
@ceridwyn_writes But if you felt like dinner again, I'd be up for that.
@ceridwyn_writes @hroethgar Sunday. Should be OK - I'm off work most of Fri with nothing to do in the a.m., and the kids are being fantastic
Very grateful to the woman who helped me find the phone and the fee waiving bank teller
Sleep deprivation sucks. So far this week I've lost an eftpos card for good and a cellphone at the supermarket for five frantic minutes.
Stupid storm, waking me up all night.
@jackelder My fav Taupo activities: AC baths, kayaking on the lake, feeding animals at Lilliput Farm, walking around
@pikelet See doctor definitely. Get a plan sorted.
@pikelet And my overall understanding is that treating concussion well in the first few weeks makes a difference to overall recovery time.
@pikelet Have you got a management plan? Colleague saw the concussion folk at the hospital for ayear & had a return-to-work plan over months
@jemyoshioka Also, great piece! Thanks for writing it and sharing. I enjoyed reading it.
@pikelet My colleague who had a nasty concussion last year seemed to need a lot more rest than usual.
@jemyoshioka Oddly, Colin Wilson (who wrote terrible wish-fulfillment horror) does a really good examination of this in 'The Mind Parasites'
@DubiousStephen my newish Xperia didn't have them as an option. Gboard has them though, so I'm good now.
@Nonwrestler I got one! Gboard will do macrons.
@Nnedi very excited to hear Akata Warrior is coming out.
@pikelet enchanting / relaxing is My Neighbour Totoro
This looks way too good to be true. https://t.co/BoiNfMQxb6 I wonder if they have an actual prototype that works and doesn't smell bad.
And last week I made lemon slice, despite a complete dearth of condensed milk in the house. https://t.co/Ek2YRFEaGY
I made a rather nice ginger slice yesterday. https://t.co/yLws7TPEHa
@pikelet There's lots of benefit for older adults in getting vaccinated against shingles if they caught chickenpox, ever.
@pikelet Ouch. I hope it gets better soon and easily.
I went to dance at The Hustle's first performance tonight. Really fun. Excellent singer. Great backing vocals. Very danceable.
So does anyone have recs of which Android apps make good macrons happen without making the whole keyboard look odd? Happy to pay a bit.
@Botanygeek @BitKblog that's a really disturbing sentence to read as a New Zealander.
@clockwork_fish I'm not really over the tui. I remember twice in my childhood seeing a tui in our garden. Twice only.
@saniac it's mostly reflective of my experience
@dimsie Magician's Nephew is a prequel, not the real first book in the series, anyway.
@DearMama_ Wow. That's not good at all.
American food blogger tries to make lamingtons with no basic familiarity with the concept: https://t.co/6p8tkJGEnm
@DearMama_ I'm pretty sure police show if called to a current home invasion.
@mizjwilliams there are tonnes of cake-cup recipes that work on the Web.
Overheard from the kids' room: "No! I never stop talking."
Sheesh. Poor Seddon is getting hammered again. #eqnz
@DearMama_ 'moe mai ra' means 'sleep' (it's a command/request), I believe.
@theArtOfPeople students who are not doing well at school is nice and non-judgemental without sounding silly.
@thomasbeagle resene do it free last I checked
@ceridwyn_writes @mssocks @clockwork_fish Congratulations!
Sometimes I just really wish parenting could be put on hold for a day or so.
My 2017 will be in the afternoon of Saturday night and I are at the gardens and a half of play and the Diamond Castle and the Diamond Castle
@WgtnCC @thomasbeagle @BarristerNZ good stuff!
@BR3NDA @hroethgar Cool! Do you mind telling me what brand? She goes back to preschool next week.
@BR3NDA Mostly, I just comb, and comb, and comb.
@BR3NDA @hroethgar I've read up on that. I have a feeling if it were that easy, we'd know for sure. There are suffocating treatments to buy.
Dear @WgtnCC please check the signs on the Southern Walkway for this vandalism, and fix! @BarristerNZ @thomasbeagle
@BR3NDA What I find really frustrating is that the only one that works says I can't apply it, or @hroethgar, because not OK for asthmatics.
@theArtOfPeople went there two days ago and agree entirely
I've hit the bit of the holidays where I've started sorting and filing stuff.
@DearMama_ I'm not getting which pool.
@ThatEricAlper @ParryKylie @hroethgar Today my child asked me why the contacts list on a phone is represented by a book.
@dimsie imagine having to look like you're attracted to Kelly when O'Conner is in the room.
@thomasbeagle 4-year-old just learnt to make amazingly accurate fart noises with a plastic cup.
@hroethgar It was nice to see good descriptions of menstruation in popular culture. Not so great that the fake blood was so obviously fake.
@saniac Original name, Moonlight Gully, much prettier
@saniac Blackball was named for a shipping line.
FFS. That's a lot of big quakes lately.
@ms_pym I think I've been not so great at self-care. Also never had good asthma training and didn't recognise symptoms or know solutions.
Merry Christmas. I hope you're all as happy as I am, still in bed with happy kids playing on the other side of the house.
@SpinoffParents A) The end made me weepy. B) Now I want a mimosa.
@shoelessgirl Ouch. Sending you all my best thoughts.
@clockwork_fish This is why gingerbread biscuits are good. You can make them well ahead.
@ms_pym Although last night's doctor says the cough and sinus may both be allergies and asthma rather than infection.
@ms_pym I don't have a frozen neck, but I'm doing 'well' on the other three fronts.
@hradzka Pretty standard. Corpses usually. https://t.co/mzIlcFQkKQ
@BR3NDA But I'm out of ideas. I hope someone more knowledgeable comes along.
@BR3NDA Thanks for an interesting rabbit hole. I've learnt lots of interesting bits. (I'd had no idea Evans Bay had a coal generator 20s-60s
@BR3NDA even in 1911, they set up a specific generator just for the trams. I'm not sure when a 24-hour whole-city domestic supply came in.
@BR3NDA it's a hard question, though. Do you mean a whole city power supply, like now, the first generator, or something else?
@BR3NDA and 1879 sports events in Wellington had arc lighting.
@BR3NDA did you find the Te Ara entry that says we had electric street lighting in 1889?
@BR3NDA sadly, all I know is that it will be in the displays in the Transpower foyer.
@MetService That was interesting, but frustrating. I can't visualise most of what you're talking about.
Best moments of 2016: 1 - holding a live falcon at Wingspan, near Rotorua
@mikokiko I thought it was straight safety and respect for other people's privacy.
@_writehanded_ your writing has made me think and try to improve things.
@ParryKylie festive marzipan fruit making with your daughter!
@LI_politico @Ellipsister ethnic affairs conference photos full of white people then.
@BR3NDA I'm glad you were there.
@BR3NDA Modern oven. Stand mixer. (Ridiculous amount of beating.) Actual caster sugar, not granulated.
4-year-old playing with small plastic animals takes the time to carefully check whether the Cerberus represents a real animal to be avoided.
@han_dall @medickinson Fantastic show.
@IonaPannett We already have a short commute to the airport. More cross-suburb buses would be good, if we really wanted to improve transport
@NelsonMail do you know if it was a fur seal?
